I am a Principal Investigator at 3Bs Research Group, University of Minho, Portugal. My research focusses on the elucidation of glycan role in cellular communication and the use of the glycans diversity in design and synthesis of functional biomaterials. We have developed new analytical methods and platforms for characterization of challenging to measure glycan-protein and glycan-cell interactions; glycan-based delivery systems; selective cancer therapies based on glycan amphiphiles and biocatalytic self-assembly; and extracellular supramolecular mimics.

Hi there! I'm Bruno, PhD in Chemistry from University of Buenos Aires. Did a first postdoc at UNC-Chapel Hill at prof. Jerry Meyer group, and currently completing a second one at ICIQ under the direction of Prof. Antoni Llobet. I'm really passionate about fundamental topics on inner and outer sphere electron transfer, intermolecular and interfacial. Lately I've been exploring more about homo- and heterogeneous catalysis (designing hybrid systems based on semiconductor-molecular cat.), while at the same time developing a borderline passion for road cycling. I plan to return to my home country soon to start my independent career, steering back to fundamental topics.
